Description: Fine vessel stand, coated in a red slip.
Curator's comments: Such stands were used to support round-bottomed vessels, whether on the floor or upon tables; otherwise they were supported in simple hollows in the mud floor. They are a common occurrence on New Kingdom settlement sites, though often fragmentary. See, for example, Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982):79 [54] from Deir el-Ballas, or P. Rose, The Eighteenth Dynasty Pottery Corpus from Amarna (MEES 83, London, 2007) 38-9, 186-91 (Tell el-Amarna)
